instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  works now but all kinds of sensing circuit issues
threads.message:
had a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> came in, clean board, no liquid spilled, had no power.

traced down to the SMC,then replaced it

machine powers on, boots, everything working. except sometimes it slows down, then ran ASD. got

VC0C,VN0C,VP0R, ID0R,IC0R,IHDC,IM0C,IO0R,IPBR,

all say the same thing : sensor reading above alarm limit.

pole around in diode mode around these signals into SMC, no short to ground.

so thought can be a bad SMC, replaced another one, same story,power up with these errors, any thoughts?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  works now but all kinds of sensing circuit issues
threads.message: What voltage do you get on pin 8 of <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  works now but all kinds of sensing circuit issues
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  works now but all kinds of sensing circuit issues
threads.message: Looks like SMC is missing AVREF which is needed for the A/D converters. Check voltage on <CAPACITOR>C4920</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  works now but all kinds of sensing circuit issues
threads.message:
FIXED! thanks a lot! turned out to be bad trace to the pad of the SMC, jumped a wire and all good now running without errors!
Thanks a lot guys,appreciate it!
